Name: Vase of Two Pieces, One Fitting Over the Other
Description: This alabaster jar had the stopper and lid removed by tomb robbers. The jar was used as a container for oils, fats, and other materials.It bears the fingerprints of thieves on its interior wall. The vase is of two pieces; one of openwork that fits over the other. When the tomb was later tidied up, empty vessels were employed as containers for smaller objects, which had been scattered by the robbers. This jar bears also a cryptograph, or secret sign, of the name of the King Neb Kheprew Re.
